basic.description:
Enumerative combinatorics is concerned with counting the number of elements of a finite set. The techniques covered include inclusion-exclusion, bijective proofs, double-counting arguments, recurrence relations, and generating functions. Given jointly with MATH 802/3.0.
LEARNING HOURS    120 (36L;84P)
RECOMMENDATION    Experience with abstract mathematics and mathematical proof, and a good foundation in linear algebra.
basic.subject: MATH
basic.title: Enumerative Combinatorics

extra.enrollment_requirement:
Recommendation    Experience with abstract mathematics and mathematical proof, and a good foundation in linear algebra.
Prerequisites     MATH210 or MATH211 or MATH212 or MATH217.
